intro: Aellenia turcomanica, commonly known as the Turcoman thornapple, is a species of flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its spiny stems and lobed leaves, and it produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. Aellenia turcomanica is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky or sandy soils. Its fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds, contributing to its dispersal in its native habitat.
